pageTitle: Itinerary for Thursday, May 26, 2016 | Prime Minister of Canada
articleHtml:
Itinerary for the Prime Minister, Justin Trudeau, for Thursday, May 26, 2016:

Kashikojima, Shima, Japan

10:45 a.m. JST The Prime Minister will attend the G7 Welcoming Ceremony.

Ujibashi Bridge
Ise Grand Shrine Jingu

Note for media:

  • Pooled photo opportunity


11:05 a.m. JST The Prime Minister will visit the Ise Grand Shrine Jingu.

Note for media:

  • Pooled photo opportunity


11:30 a.m. JST The Prime Minister will take part in the G7 Official Family Photograph.

Main Sanctuary
Ise Grand Shrine Jingu

Note for media:

  • Pooled photo opportunity


1:00 p.m. JST The Prime Minister will hold a bilateral meeting with the Chancellor of the Federal Republic of Germany, Angela Merkel.

Room Hagi, 3rd floor,
Shima Kanko Hotel The Classic

Note for media:

  • Photo opportunity only


1:30 p.m. JST The Prime Minister will participate in the G7 Working Luncheon (Session I).

Note for media:

  • Host broadcaster only


3:30 p.m. JST The Prime Minister will participate in the G7 Working Session II.

Closed to media.

4:40 p.m. JST The Prime Minister will participate in the G7 Working Session III.                                 

Closed to media.

6:15 p.m. JST The Prime Minister will hold a bilateral meeting with the President of France, François Hollande.

Room Hagi, 3rd floor,
Shima Kanko Hotel The Classic

Note for media:

  • Photo opportunity only


7:10 p.m. JST The Prime Minister and Mrs. Grégoire Trudeau will attend a Reception with G7 Leaders and Spouses.

Closed to media.

7:40 p.m. JST The Prime Minister will participate in a working dinner given by the Prime Minister of Japan (Session IV).

Closed to media.


Please note: all times are local.

PMO Media Relations:
Media@pmo-cpm.gc.ca
613-957-5555
